TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
>

> Sooner or later, someone *will* be a cat to space... and very quickly regret it. ![:wacko:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_wacko.png ":wacko:")
> 

I hope this guy brought bandages and disinfectant along in the cockpit...

Spoiler

![uz3wiuk.png?w=590](https://miepvonsydow.files.wordpress.com/2014/03/uz3wiuk.png?w=590)

Also, [this](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-2424367/Ever-wondered-cats-pigeons-react-zero-gravity-U-S-Air-Force-bizarre-set-animal-space-experiments.html).

....And with that, can we gently nudge this thread back on topic, folks?  If you've got questions for the moderators about the forums, here's the place.  If you'd like to talk about astrofelines and similar topics, perhaps take it to a different thread?  ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

It took me entirely too long to figure out why I couldn't see [@YNM](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/98447-ynm/)'s reply to the Simple Rockets 2 thread.  I was seriously wondering if I'd hidden him or not...  He hasn't even posted in that thread.

Turns out the forum is just confused.

![YNM.png](http://u.cubeupload.com/Geonovast/YNM.png)

Any way to avoid this, or did the software just see the post happening at the same planck time?

Hi guys, yeah its a bug, I couldn't replicate though, Im going to report it to IPS.

I'm not sure what the problem is, but the "November Threads of the 2/3rds Month" thread crashes the site, attempts to reload, and then fails to do so and crashes again. Happens on all of my browsers (Safari, Firefox, Chrome on MacOS; Safari, Brave on iOS; haven't tried on Windows), and some of those browsers just straight up crash. Occurs regardless of if I'm logged in or not.

> 
> 
> 17 minutes ago, Cydonian Monk said:
> 
> 
> I'm not sure what the problem is, but the "November Threads of the 2/3rds Month" thread crash﻿es the site, atte﻿mpts to reload, and then fails to do so and crashes again. Happens on all of my browsers (Safari, Firefox, Chrome on MacOS; Safari, Brave on iOS; haven't tried on Windows), and some of those browsers just straight up crash. Occurs regardless of if I'm logged in or not.
> 

Chrome and firefox with windows 10 seems to work, as well as chrome on android. I hate to ask, but have you tried clearing cache/cookies?

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, Mad Rocket Scientist said:
> 
> 
> Chrome and firefox with windows 10 seems to work, as well as chrome on android. I hate to ask, but have you tried clearing cache/cookies?
> 

No, but I don't see how either would cause the crash I'm seeing. I also never visit the forum on three of the browsers I listed, so their caches would already be null. 

Edit: It appears to be a javascript or some other post-load crash. I can't get anything in terms of debugging atm as I'm currently on mobile and the crash kills the developer tools....

[@Vanamonde](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/27914-vanamonde/) tags?

Yes, they are sometimes very annoying. Even harder to delete them once they are in the post.

The only issue with the tags I recall having is a deletion issue.  I did the @, and then typed their name with a 's at the end.  I was able to select their name still, but the 's disappeared, and I was unable to delete it.  I had to refresh the page and use the clear editor option to fix it.

Always select the name before adding the 's, kids.

[@Vanamonde](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/27914-vanamonde/), I've noticed that there seem to be more squad staff around than usual. Most of them have little or no forum reputation. Are they actual staff or just robots? Or are they tech support?

Figments of you imagination, as far as I can tell. 

There are no bots, but a lot of the Squad people are not prolific posters and so have accumulated little rep.
I just looked all the way down the index (or the forum homepage), and saw that on one day in 2016, 4,038 people were on here. Why were so many on at that moment? A new update? Celebration? Glitch?

I can't believe I thought the comic sans thing was so hilarious back then.

> 22 hours ago, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said:
> 
> 
> 4,038 people were on here.
> 

A lot of those would be spiders sent out over the net by the search engines.  The spiders just jump from link to link to see what they can find and report back to HQ.
Forums running extremely draggy for anyone else today?

> 
> 
> 25 minutes ago, Geonovast said:
> 
> 
> Forums running extremely draggy for anyone else today?
> 

Not for me.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Gargamel said:
> 
> 
> A lot of those would be spiders sent out over the net by the search engines.  The spiders just jump from link to link to see what they can find and report back to HQ.
> 

Explain?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, The\_Cat\_In\_Space said:
> 
> 
> Explain?
> 

The "Spiders" are sent out from a website. They find out the URL of their current location and what links are on the page. It picks one and follows it, then repeats again, etc. After a while it jumps back to its starting point and offloads all the data. Thats how results are added to search engines like google. While they were on this site they might have appeared as guest users.
